metadata.Title: CVE-2020-15999 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - high.
metadata.Description:
Heap buffer overflow in Freetype in Google Chrome prior to 86.0.4240.111 allowed a remote attacker to potentially exploit heap corruption via a crafted HTML page.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-15999` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 86.0.4240.198-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 86.0.4240.198-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 86.0.4240.198-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 86.0.4240.198-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 86.0.4240.198-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

freetype2-demos - 2.8.1-2ubuntu2.1
libfreetype6 - 2.8.1-2ubuntu2.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '86.0.4240.198-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
freetype package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.8.1-2ubuntu2.1').
